steps.s2: Add participants and products by the form or by a CSV file
steps.s3: Click button to create questionnaires for the participants
steps.s4: Send e-mail with link to each participant's questionnaire
steps.s5: See Participants quiestnnaire completion in Dashboards
steps.s6: Click 'Generate Result' button and be redirected to the report
steps.s7: You can check anytime the results in the 'Results' section

steps.s1: Access the link provided by your administrator which contains the questionnaire

questionnaire.tooltip: You need to add at least 2 participants before generating the questionnaires.

q1.q: - How can I add new participants after generating the questionnaires?

a.a1: If you forgot to add any participant to the team, don't worry, you can backtrack and follow the next process:
a.a2: Click on Reset Phase, this will allow you to continue adding members to the team.
a.a3: Once you have finished adding participants, you can regenerate the questionnaires by clicking on Create Questionnaires.

q2.q: - How can I change my password?
q2.a: You can access My Account directly, where you'll be able to update your password. If you forget your password, you can reset it at the login screen by clicking on Forgot password?. Then, you'll receive an email to set a new password.

q3.q: - How can I add multiple participants at once?

a.a1: You can upload a CSV file containing participants' emails and names in the Participants section. The CSV file should have the following format:
a.a3: Add these headers to the columns: name, email. Order doesn't matter.
a.a4: Rows below the headers should contain the participants' information.
a.a5: The maximum number of participants you can upload at once is 200.

p4.title: Pattern 1 - Two Nodes
p4.subtitle: You can see two connected nodes, that means these nodes have some relation or interaction. Meantime, one of nodes is bigger, another one smaller. That means, the bigger node got a higher influence rate by smaller one and vise-versa.

p5.title: Pattern 2 - Three Nodes - One Disconnected
p5.subtitle: Three nodes with visible three levels of influence. The biggest got the highest rate from other two nodes, meantime others got 50% less and 90% less than the biggest one. Meantime, two of them are disconnected, that means they don't havr any interaction.

p9.title: Pattern 6 - Thirty Nodes - Random Influence And Connection
p9.subtitle: Description of the p6.

m1.title: Model 1 - Strategic Decision-Making
m1.subtitle: Understanding societal influences allows companies to make informed decisions about their products, services, and operations. For instance, a report might reveal shifting societal attitudes towards sustainability, prompting a company to invest in eco-friendly practices or develop environmentally conscious products to align with consumer preferences.

m2.title: Model 2 - Reputation Management
m2.subtitle: Companies can use insights from a society influence report to manage their reputation effectively. By understanding societal values, expectations, and concerns, they can tailor their communications and actions to resonate positively with their target audience, thereby enhancing brand image and credibility.

m3.title: Model 3 - Risk Management
m3.subtitle: Societal trends and shifts can pose risks to businesses, such as regulatory changes, boycotts, or negative public perception. A society influence report can help identify and mitigate these risks by providing early warnings and guidance on how to adapt strategies and operations accordingly.

m4.title: Model 4 - Innovation and Product Development​
m4.subtitle: Companies can leverage societal influence reports to identify emerging trends and consumer demands, driving innovation and product development. By staying ahead of societal shifts, companies can develop products and services that meet evolving customer needs, gaining a competitive edge in the market.

m5.title: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)
m5.subtitle: A society influence report can inform a company’s CSR initiatives by highlighting social issues and areas where the company can make a positive impact. This can include supporting community projects, promoting diversity and inclusion, or addressing environmental concerns, thereby enhancing corporate citizenship and stakeholder engagement.

m6.title: Policy Development
m6.subtitle: Society influence reports offer insights into societal trends, preferences, and needs within the city’s population. This information can inform the development of policies and initiatives that address pressing social, economic, and environmental challenges, ensuring that city representatives can effectively respond to the evolving needs of residents.

m7.title: Urban Planning
m7.subtitle: Understanding societal influences helps city representatives make informed decisions about urban development and infrastructure projects. By considering factors such as demographic shifts, cultural preferences, and lifestyle trends, urban planners can design cities that are more livable, sustainable, and inclusive, enhancing the quality of life for residents.

m8.title: Equity and Social Justice
m8.subtitle: Insights from society influence reports can help city representatives identify disparities and inequities within the community, such as access to resources, opportunities, and services. This enables policymakers to implement targeted interventions and programs that promote social justice, reduce inequality, and create more inclusive communities.

m9.title: Environmental Sustainability
m9.subtitle: Understanding societal influences allows city representatives to develop and implement strategies for environmental sustainability and climate resilience. By promoting sustainable practices, reducing carbon emissions, and enhancing green infrastructure, policymakers can mitigate the impact of climate change and create healthier, more resilient cities for future generations.

m10.title: Public Health and Well-being
m10.subtitle: Society influence reports can inform public health initiatives and programs aimed at improving the well-being of residents. By identifying health trends, lifestyle preferences, and social determinants of health, city representatives can develop policies that promote physical activity, mental health, and access to healthcare services, fostering a healthier and more resilient population.

m11.title: Crisis Management and Resilience
m11.subtitle: Insights from society influence reports can help city representatives anticipate and respond to crises, such as natural disasters, public health emergencies, or social unrest. By understanding societal dynamics and vulnerabilities, policymakers can develop robust emergency preparedness plans, coordinate response efforts, and build community resilience in the face of adversity.

m12.title: Interdisciplinary Connections
m12.subtitle: Society influence reports often cover a wide range of topics and disciplines, providing opportunities for interdisciplinary learning and assessment. Educators can design assessments that integrate insights from multiple fields, encouraging students to make connections across subjects and apply their knowledge in diverse contexts.

m13.title: Contextual Understanding​
m13.subtitle: Society influence reports provide educators with insights into broader societal trends, cultural dynamics, and social issues that may impact students’ learning experiences and academic performance. This contextual understanding allows teachers to tailor instruction and assessment strategies to better meet the needs and interests of diverse student populations.

m14.title: Relevance and Engagement
m14.subtitle: Incorporating insights from society influence reports into classroom assessments can enhance the relevance and engagement of learning materials for students. By connecting academic content to real-world issues and societal trends, educators can make learning more meaningful and compelling, fostering deeper understanding and retention of key concepts.

m15.title: Model 15 - Student Empowerment
m15.subtitle: Incorporating society influence reports into classroom assessments empowers students to become agents of change in their communities. Assessments that challenge students to investigate societal issues, advocate for social justice, and take meaningful action foster a sense of agency and responsibility, empowering students to make a positive impact on the world around them.
